title: New computer data
content:
New computer (Windows 11) shows 'Old Firefox Data'. Opened hidden files. Using File Explorer found Profile Folder & renamed it 'old'. Copied and pasted 'Old Firefox Data' as new profile. Firefox would not open. Had to remove etc and Firefox worked again. Thought this maybe the easiest way to get my Bookmarks back.

PS Presume Profile Folder does not contain Thunderbird Addresses?
creator: Eanie

title: I've lost my bookmarks and passwords after refreshing firefox
content: I seem to have lost all of my bookmarks and passwords associated with my application, even though the message before I refreshed/restarted the application said that it would keep that important information, just remove things like themes and add on extensions. What do I do? I tried to go to manage bookmarks first, and under the import option, it says how many tabs were bookmarked or saves, or something, but when I go to click to restore it, it says it cannot be restored. I feel like its somewhere still there, and I really need some of that information. Any help is appreciated, thank you
creator: 7treesinthewoods

title: Cierres continuos
content: Llevo meses con problemas con Mozilla. Se cuelga y me pide cerrar el programa. Suele suceder cuando estoy cargando archivos adjuntos, pero es demasiado frecuente. Ya lo restablecí 3 veces, también lo desinstalé y volví a instalar. Ya no sé qué mas hacer. Tengo Windows 11
creator: volga.depina

title: Downloading English as my first language for the browser
content: I want to get rid of the French language in my browser!!!!!!!!!!!!
creator: domi246

title: Google search page not displaying correctly in troubleshooting mode, but does display correctly in private window
content: When I do a Google search, the icons/buttons for Web, Images, Shopping, etc. do not display correctly. I can only see the tops of the buttons. I tried disabling my plugins but that didn't help. I launched FF in troubleshooting mode and that still did not resolve it. So far, I've only found two ways to fix it. I can either view it in a private window or I can use the User Agent Switcher plugin to force it to Chrome. This is something that just recently started, probably beginning with v119 or even 119.01.
creator: Neiby
